This is all things considered from NPR News I'm Ari Shapiro and I melted Chang in the weeks and Christine Blasey Ford acute Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh sexually assault press conference spawn has been relatively restraint

Response to all of this controversy and she joins us now Hey Daniel hello so as we noted the president's tone it shifted dramatically last night and I just want to start out by talking about how his comment last night compared to how he's been talking about Ford up until last night
Sure so late last week after Christine Blasey Ford and Brett Kavanaugh testified before the Senate Judiciary committee Trump had taken a much softer tone towards Christine Blasey Ford
I vote or just a motor users can do as a woman now he
Seemed to be sort of you in to the line that congressional Republicans seemed to be healing to which was something to the effect of Christine Blasey Ford's seems credible but you know maybe she's mistaken or I Wish we had more corroborating evidence but a lot of them used that key word credible
Then last night he got up in front of the crowd and he he was mimicking her and the fact that you know she can't remember every single thing that happened that night so he was really diverting from that line and he was playing it to laugh than cheers from that audience yeah you can hear the tape and so that has people really upset today some
How the response has been in the Senate because to get Kavanaugh through Senate Republicans are focusing on two teeth Senator Lisa Murkowski of Alaska and Susan Collins of Maine how either of those

Been swirling in the middle of all of this is the fact that Trump has talked about how he actually empathize with Kavanaugh because he himself has been accused of sexual assault of sexual misconduct
Absolutely he has more than a dozen accusations of misconduct against him and like Brett Kavanaugh Trump is denying all of the allegations against him but that's not the only echo here I mean look look at how Trump has responded to those allegations likewise
And one of those allegations against Trump adjust the leads that woman who said he had groped her on an airplane decades ago he also mocked her after that allegation came out the quote that he said was she wouldn't be my first choice he likewise said that to a crowd the crowd likewise lasted shared

Chang and I'm Ari Shapiro many people in the U.S auto industry are breathing a sigh of relief this week the new trade deal between the U.S Mexico and Canada and months of uncertainty if it's approved by Congress it will spare carmakers from some of the terrorists that they had feared
And we'll send a senior vice president of the motor and equipment Manufacturers Association which represents more than a thousand companies that make auto parts here in the U. S. thanks for joining us here on all things considered thank you I glad to be with you to begin with what you just described for listeners what you remember companies making and where you are in the auto making supply chain
And components for maintenance and repair
And how much was on the line for you in this trade agreement ... holding a rough to see what the details would be
Well our industry has actually done quite well entered after we've actually been able to grow our supply chain in North America we've been able to grow manufacturing jobs in the United states but it counts and all three countries being part of the agreement
So we are very pleased to relieved to that all three parties were able to come to an agreement this weekend we're cautiously optimistic that the terms of the agreement will work for the industry and for the American public
When you look at the details of the agreement can you tell how it compares to NAFTA for you
Well there's going to be an increase in the amount of North American content that will be required
For parts to travel through the three countries are going to have to call it the U.S Mexico Canada agreement but traveled through North America without having to pay tariffs there's going to be a requirement for more North American steel and aluminum [noise]
Ah so all of that will impact our members and in addition there's going to be some new administrative costs that are going to be required one of the concerns we have though are there some new tariffs
This November So on the one hand there won't be terrible for material crossing Canada U.S Mexico border is on the other hand the steel and aluminum tariffs that were of concern to your industry they're not gone away
No they have and I think one of the things we have the mind as they have been a particular burden to smaller manufacturers and many of these smaller manufacturers are only in the U.S
And some of our members have seen the costs but they're still purchases rise almost fifty percent so this is a significant increase it's typically of concern between Canada and the United states we'd like to see those two countries roll up their sleeves uses same energy they use to conclude this this new NAFTA
And be able to come to some kind of agreement on steel and aluminum tariffs
I Know that there's a lot of relief from the auto industry now that the uncertainty is gone but how does this compare to the old rules under NAFTA isn't an improvement just is it worse well
I think from the United states perspective one of the things in the United states said little pool through was an increase in the U.S content and for some of our suppliers and some component manufacturers this is going to be a challenge there is no doubt about that
I Do think that we're going to see more steel moral lumina that's from North America and our
Can minimize those costs because consumers are going to get any value out of it and that's going to be our next a real challenge for as we move forward that Greenland
And Wilson is senior vice president of the motor and equipment Manufacturers Association thanks for speaking with us today thank you it's a pleasure

Communities across the country are grappling with a new kind of chemical pollution in drinking water it called pee fast a group of thousands of chemical used for decades and products like Teflon pan
That science than regulation around this still aren't settled leaving some people in limbo New Hampshire Public Radio's Annie Ropeik has the story
Jillian lanes family built a house in a tree lined hold us back in the New Hampshire town of ... on a recent morning as she wrangled her young daughter the door she pointed out a picture window for the woods in the backyard
And that's what
It is a federal Superfund site called Coakley landfill lane didn't even know it was there until two years ago when she heard of a nightmarish discovery nearby a cancer cluster of young kids
Was just a comment from a Public Citizen that set a Coakley question mark and I was like totally attackers ... so I started Googling it
She found a former town dumb but turned toxic waste cleanup area just through the woods and ... [noise] Bob Sullivan city attorney of nearby port Smith he does the landfill now a huge grassy hill used to be an empty Corey
And that was actually kind of stayed back in the Nineteen seventies when people looking to get rid of municipal waste trash they would find a whole and go somewhere and fill it up [noise] probably seemed like a good idea
Heavy metal than manmade toxins were keeping from the landfill into neighbors' water wells Coakley shut down and became a Superfund site in the mid eighties it was covered with a cap to keep praying from washing out more Thompson
For years this put the public fears to rest then amid news of the cancer cluster in twenty sixteen workers made an alarming discovery high levels of pee fast chemicals and surface waters around the landfill
Since then traces of these industrial toxins have also turned up in nearby wells
Officials are still working to pinpoint where the chemicals come from and they may never be sure what caused the cancer cluster but
So we're drinking the water and wear bathing in it were brush our teeth in it and we have no idea that we're living with this potential
Problem lane family spent thousands of dollars on high tech water filters and she devoted countless hours to public meetings and petition for more clean up an aid
The environmental protection agency says the ... nearby wells it's not a threat based on state and federal standards but that doesn't quite line up with a June report from the Centers for Disease Control it says ... may threatened human health at level ten times lower than what the EPA in states like New Hampshire advise
At a recent federal meeting on ... New Hampshire atop CDC official bill ... tried to clarify
This is not a bright line here we're not saying that exposures estimated above are minimal risk levels are to be associated with Bill Hicks
He thought the CDC focuses on public health not regulations though it's research could play into new state and federal standards in the future And Julian lanes well the ... level is lower even than what the CDC says may be risky but she's still feels the government is failing her community
Public shouldn't have to be driving this process you know none of that contributed to building trust with the public pee fast chemical
And she just doesn't want to live near Coakley landfill anymore for NPR News I'm Annie Ropeik in Greenland New Hampshire

No evidence that there was such a central database the two agents he's actually had computer systems that could not communicate with each other
And the inspector general found that when distraught parents tried to track down their children
The government sometimes gave them inconsistent or just wrong information in some cases parents couldn't communicate with their kids at all then what happened to their families
The government was ordered to reunify them by a federal judge and it has reconnected more than two thousand children with their parents but the inspector general's report says that this lack of communication made that reunification process lower and the process was especially hard for children who are still young that they couldn't speak image
It was only through communication with the parents that the authorities were able to find these children and reunite them
Still have federal officials responded to the inspector general's report in any way
Well as the administration often does it is blaming quote immigration laws that are broken and poorly written unquote
Th as does say that it deserves some credit for working quote exhaustively to reunite these families although again they were ordered to do so by a judge but the H. S. also acknowledge that the government's computer systems still do not communicate across these agencies
Are there any children still haven't been reunited with their parents

This is all things considered ... Chang and I'm Ari Shapiro survivors of sexual assault are sharing their stories many for the first time Washington Post columnist Monica ... has been getting a steady stream of them in her inbox
And her latest column has the headline deer dads your daughters told me about their assault this is why they never told you
A lot of survivors wanting to share their stories of sexual assault and what was notable to me is how many of them had a common thread of the one person I have never told my dad I don't think he could handle this
And what did they tell you about the reason they never told their father
Is some women said I'm afraid to tell my father because I I Know he would kill the men who attacked me and I'm worried he would go to jail
Some women said I've never seen my father cry and I know that if I told him that would make him cry that someone did say I'm afraid my father wouldn't believe me and that that's a whole different strain
But a lot of them were really more I think he would believe me but I'm afraid it would just destroy him he thinks it to the job to protect me and he would feel like he failed
... is it only fathers or are people concerned about telling their mothers as well [noise]
I did get responses from people concerned about telling their mother but
I think often survivors are putting their parents in different categories a lot of women said I told my mother and learned that she had been a victim to or I told my mother because I thought she would understand what it's like to walk through the world as a young woman and so they they were really afraid that
You're right that a lot of ... just because women don't want to make men uncomfortable with lady pain explain what you mean by that
You know just just think about trope in sitcoms where
The dad is sent to buy a pack of ... for his daughters or his wife and it's presented as
The most humiliating embarrassing journey to the grocery store that he can ever make we do that with ... we do that with breast feeding all of these things that happen on a woman's body are seen as being
Really embarrassing and inappropriate to talk about and I think that that exist on a spectrum where we're afraid to talk about sexual assault because it falls on this spectrum
Of growth or uncomfortable things that happen to women [noise]
Can you tell us about some of the responses that you've had to this call him for that was published this week
[laughter] yeah I've received more than five hundred emails in the past twenty four hours but if you don't mind I'll just I'll read you my my favorite response yup lose

My daughters and she said do you think you're ready I didn't answer but I'll do it soon not today but the next time I see them right now though I'll have a couple of drinks and I'll think
I Hope I can be of some comfort semper fi
Well so I've gotten a lot of emails like that a lot of emails from dads who are good dad [noise] they're just really trying to think about what it means to be a good dad
I've gotten a lot of emails from men who stay I always told my daughter if anyone tries to hurt you on murder them and now I'm ... thinking was that the right message to send
Because what if that kept her silence because she didn't want me to go to jail for for murdering someone um so I think that these are conversations that have just been happening in secret for really long time and good men are trying to figure out how to be a part of the conversation then how to be a comfort in them
As part of your argument also that it's important for daughters to tell their fathers about this so that they have a better understanding of the women go through
